intro: Calochortus greenei var. calvus, commonly known as the Sierra Death Camas, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to California. It belongs to the Liliaceae family and is characterized by its striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, dry habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it produces a bulbous root system. This variety is distinguished by its finely hairy stems and is considered a rare and endangered species.
